See the * GNU General Public License for more details. * * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License * along with this program. If not, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses/. * --------------------------------------------------------------------- * * Version: $Rev$
This configuration provides locale-dependent names for warnings and error messages in a (graphical) user interface. Although the preferred way would be to have separate key-value pairs for actual labels and their corresponding tooltips, you may want to use just one key-value pair, in which the tooltip is located after the separator ";". Otherwise, please use the suffix "_TOOLTIP" to indicate a tooltip for some label.
Please see the JavaDoc for MessageFormatter and Formatter.
properties.entry: Define your preferences for the behavior of SBMLsqueezer

Launch SBML2LaTeX to write a comprehensive model report that gives a better overview about the content of the current model. If you have LaTeX installed on your system, you can directly generate a PDF file, which SBML2LaTeXr will display upon creation. You can also store just the TeX file, which can help you preparing your paper.

Launch SBML2LaTeX to create a report file describing the current reaction with all of its participants and components and store it in a file. If you have LaTeX installed on your system, SBML2LaTeX can directly display the resulting PDF file upon creation. You can also generate a TeX file to support scientific writing.
Display the online help including basic information about SBMLsqueezer, command-line usage and further information.
Open the kinetic law wizard and create equations for all reactions within the model in a single go.
Generate a kinetic law for the currently selected reaction.
Display the content of the current model in an alternative way, including all model components.
Converting CellDesigner's data structure to JSBML objects
